intro: Teucrium polium var. pseudohyssopus, commonly known as False Hyssop, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features aromatic, gray-green leaves with a fuzzy texture and small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with branched stems and a compact, bushy habit. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for both ornamental gardening and traditional herbal uses.
